segment.source: Lab 1b: Add an app to your image
segment.target: Lab 1b: Add an app to your image

segment.source: Lab 1b: Add an app to your image
segment.target: Lab 1b: Add an app to your image

segment.source: This content has been tested on Windows 10 IoT Core Build 10586.
segment.target: This content has been tested on Windows 10 IoT Core Build 10586.

segment.source: Some of these procedures do not yet work on newer preview builds, including Windows 10 Anniversary SDK Preview Build 14295.
segment.target: Some of these procedures do not yet work on newer preview builds, including Windows 10 Anniversary SDK Preview Build 14295.

segment.source: We're now going to take an app (like the sample Hello, World!
segment.target: We're now going to take an app (like the sample Hello, World!

segment.source: app), package it up, and create a new image you can load onto new devices.
segment.target: app), package it up, and create a new image you can load onto new devices.

segment.source: Note As we go through this manufacturing guide, ProjectA will start to resemble the SampleA image that's in C:IoT-ADK-AddonKitSource-armProductsSampleA.
segment.target: Note As we go through this manufacturing guide, ProjectA will start to resemble the SampleA image that's in C:IoT-ADK-AddonKitSource-armProductsSampleA.

segment.source: Prerequisites
segment.target: Prerequisites

segment.source: We'll use the ProjectA image we created from Lab 1a: Create a basic image.
segment.target: We'll use the ProjectA image we created from Lab 1a: Create a basic image.

segment.source: Create and test an Windows app
segment.target: Create and test an Windows app

segment.source: You can skip these steps if you've already created and tested your app.
segment.target: You can skip these steps if you've already created and tested your app.

segment.source: Create an app.
segment.target: Create an app.

segment.source: This can be any app designed for IoT Core, saved as an Appx Package.
segment.target: This can be any app designed for IoT Core, saved as an Appx Package.

segment.source: For our example, we use the Hello, World app.
segment.target: For our example, we use the Hello, World app.

segment.source: In Visual Studio, to save the Hello, World app as an Appx package, click Project > Store > Create App PackagesNext.
segment.target: In Visual Studio, to save the Hello, World app as an Appx package, click Project > Store > Create App PackagesNext.

segment.source: Select:
segment.target: Select:

segment.source: Output location: C:\HelloWorld (or any other path that doesn't include spaces.)
segment.target: Output location: C:\HelloWorld (or any other path that doesn't include spaces.)

segment.source: Generate app bundle: Never
segment.target: Generate app bundle: Never

segment.source: Then click Create.
segment.target: Then click Create.

segment.source: Visual Studio creates the Appx file into C:\HelloWorld\HelloWorld_1.0.0.0_Debug_Test
segment.target: Visual Studio creates the Appx file into C:\HelloWorld\HelloWorld_1.0.0.0_Debug_Test

segment.source: Optional: (Test the app)[test-the-app.md].
segment.target: Optional: (Test the app)[test-the-app.md].

segment.source: Note, you may have already tested the app as part of building the project.
segment.target: Note, you may have already tested the app as part of building the project.

segment.source: Package the app
segment.target: Package the app

segment.source: Create a package for an app
segment.target: Create a package for an app

segment.source: Open C:IoT-ADK-AddonKitToolsIoTCoreShell as an administrator.
segment.target: Open C:IoT-ADK-AddonKitToolsIoTCoreShell as an administrator.

segment.source: Create a working folder for the app, for example:
segment.target: Create a working folder for the app, for example:

segment.source: This creates a new working folder at C:IoT-ADK-AddonKitSource-archPackagesAppx.HelloWorld that includes files that you'll use to help build the package.
segment.target: This creates a new working folder at C:IoT-ADK-AddonKitSource-archPackagesAppx.HelloWorld that includes files that you'll use to help build the package.

segment.source: Troubleshooting: If you get the message: "The system cannot find the file specified", it may be because the package has no defined dependencies.
segment.target: Troubleshooting: If you get the message: "The system cannot find the file specified", it may be because the package has no defined dependencies.

segment.source: From the IoT Core Shell, build the package.
segment.target: From the IoT Core Shell, build the package.

segment.source: The package is built, appearing as C:IoT-ADK-AddonKitBuildarchpkgsyour OEM name.Appx.HelloWorld.cab.
segment.target: The package is built, appearing as C:IoT-ADK-AddonKitBuildarchpkgsyour OEM name.Appx.HelloWorld.cab.

segment.source: Watch for any build errors, and correct them - often these are a result of filenames in the package definition file being different from the actual filenames.
segment.target: Watch for any build errors, and correct them - often these are a result of filenames in the package definition file being different from the actual filenames.

segment.source: Update the feature manifest
segment.target: Update the feature manifest

segment.source: Add your app package to the feature manifest
segment.target: Add your app package to the feature manifest

segment.source: Open your feature manifest file, C:IoT-ADK-AddonKitSource-archPackagesOEMFM.xml
segment.target: Open your feature manifest file, C:IoT-ADK-AddonKitSource-archPackagesOEMFM.xml

segment.source: Create a new PackageFile section in the XML, with your package file listed, and give it a new FeatureID, such as "AppxHelloWorld".
segment.target: Create a new PackageFile section in the XML, with your package file listed, and give it a new FeatureID, such as "AppxHelloWorld".

segment.source: You'll now be able to add your app to any of your products by adding a reference to this feature manifest and Feature ID.
segment.target: You'll now be able to add your app to any of your products by adding a reference to this feature manifest and Feature ID.

segment.source: Update the project's configuration files
segment.target: Update the project's configuration files

segment.source: Replace your product's default app with your own
segment.target: Replace your product's default app with your own

segment.source: Open your product's test configuration file: C:IoT-ADK-AddonKitSource-archProductsProductATestOEMInput.xml.
segment.target: Open your product's test configuration file: C:IoT-ADK-AddonKitSource-archProductsProductATestOEMInput.xml.

segment.source: Make sure both your feature manifest, OEMFM.xml, and the feature manifest: OEMCommonFM.xml, are both listed in the AdditionalFMs section.
segment.target: Make sure both your feature manifest, OEMFM.xml, and the feature manifest: OEMCommonFM.xml, are both listed in the AdditionalFMs section.

segment.source: Add the FeatureIDs for both your app package, as well as the OEMCustomCmd package, which is used to launch your app.
segment.target: Add the FeatureIDs for both your app package, as well as the OEMCustomCmd package, which is used to launch your app.

segment.source: Remove the FeatureID for the OEM_AppxMain.
segment.target: Remove the FeatureID for the OEM_AppxMain.

segment.source: Remove the FeatureID for the IoT Core default app (IOTBERTHA) and the IOT_ALLJOYN_APP either by using !-- ... -- to comment it out, or delete it from the list:
segment.target: Remove the FeatureID for the IoT Core default app (IOTBERTHA) and the IOT_ALLJOYN_APP either by using !-- ... -- to comment it out, or delete it from the list:

segment.source: Set the app to automatically install and set itself as the default app
segment.target: Set the app to automatically install and set itself as the default app

segment.source: Open C:IoT-ADK-AddonKitSource-archProductsProductAOEMCustomization.cmd
segment.target: Open C:IoT-ADK-AddonKitSource-archProductsProductAOEMCustomization.cmd

segment.source: Recommended: Change the device's default username and password.
segment.target: Recommended: Change the device's default username and password.

segment.source: Remove the first set of REM statements from the code block starting with "REM if exist..", this allows the AppInstall.cmd command to automatically install your app.
segment.target: Remove the first set of REM statements from the code block starting with "REM if exist..", this allows the AppInstall.cmd command to automatically install your app.

segment.source: Build and test the image
segment.target: Build and test the image

segment.source: From the IoT Core Shell, create the image:
segment.target: From the IoT Core Shell, create the image:

segment.source: This creates the product binaries at C:IoT-ADK-AddonKitBuildarchProductAFlash.FFU.
segment.target: This creates the product binaries at C:IoT-ADK-AddonKitBuildarchProductAFlash.FFU.

segment.source: Troubleshooting: Check the logfiles at C:iot-adk-addonkitBuildarchHelloWorld_Test.log, and search for "fatal error".
segment.target: Troubleshooting: Check the logfiles at C:iot-adk-addonkitBuildarchHelloWorld_Test.log, and search for "fatal error".

segment.source: Install the image onto the Micro SD card.
segment.target: Install the image onto the Micro SD card.

segment.source: Start Windows IoT Core Dashboard
segment.target: Start Windows IoT Core Dashboard

segment.source:
Setup a new device
Custom, click Browse, and select your image.
segment.target:
Setup a new device
Custom, click Browse, and select your image.

segment.source: Put the Micro SD card in the device, select it, accept the license terms, and click Install.
segment.target: Put the Micro SD card in the device, select it, accept the license terms, and click Install.

segment.source: This replaces the previous image with your new image.
segment.target: This replaces the previous image with your new image.

segment.source: Put the card into the IoT device and start it up.
segment.target: Put the card into the IoT device and start it up.

segment.source: After a short while, the device should start automatically, and you should see your app.
segment.target: After a short while, the device should start automatically, and you should see your app.

segment.source: Next steps
segment.target: Next steps

segment.target: Lab 1c: Add a file and a registry setting to an image
